title: Why does YouTube lower my video audio? Videos on my computer are at a good loud, but not too loud, volume, but when I upload them to YouTube, the volume is noticeably quieter. Why is this? - Quora

response.answer_text: Youtube has a loudness normalization function that is automatically applied to most videos. It lowers the audio of the entire video if it’s average loudness is above a certain value, somewhere around -13 LUFS (Loudness Untits Full Scale). Music streaming services like Spotify, Tidal, and iTunes have similar things, but with different target values.
